intro: Dodonaea polyandra, commonly known as the silky oaks or silky hakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its smooth, silver-green foliage and showy, pale yellow or cream-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a soft, velvety texture, while its flowers are clustered in panicles. Dodonaea polyandra is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in various ecological settings.
